column4: so im getting this message: " Duplicate sources.list entry "  when running updates on my 10.04 installation ... and heres my sources.list http://pastie.org/4522800  any idea which is a duplicate?
Have you also checked the lists in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/ directory?
the pastie is updated with the whole error message ...
nope... do "grep 'archive\.canonical\.com' /etc/apt/sources.list.d/*"  ... that will show if there are other entries
There you go! You have the archive listed in the main sources.list and in an add-on... check "Software Sources" from the Software Center and disable the additional sources
pardon me, you're on 10.04 ... use Synaptics ... Software Sources menu option
I'd suggest disabling the latter
hang on...
I suspect "source control" means the source-code link (deb-src ...) there's usually one of those for each "deb"
just disable both of them in the Other sources, update, and test
looks like we're good!!!
great :)
I think what you want is to put the process into the background so control of the terminal returns to you. To do that in a shell, postfix  the "&" character to your commands
Did you press Ctrl+Z ... that will suspend a process and but it in the background
grep -r class *.rb
You said "recursively from the current dir, right?" ... I showed you how to search from the current directory, since your example would have searched from root "/"
but that didn't do what I was expecting
However, if the file-names you are searching for begin with a "." you need to do "grep -r class {.,}*.rb
See the zip "-x" option ... e.g. "zip archive "*.h" "*.c" -x donotinclude.h orthis.h"
Yes, the /usr/local/ directories are the place... it sounds like the kind of thing you'd put in /usr/local/etc/<appname>/
thanks
